contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Two ships of the [[United States Navy]] have borne the name '''''Richard E. Byrd''''', in honor of polar explorer [[Rear Admiral]] [[Richard E. Byrd]] (1888â€“1957). * [[USS Richard E. Byrd (DDG-23)|USS ''Richard E. Byrd'' (DDG-23)]] was a [[Charles F. Adams-class destroyer|''Charles F. Adams''-class]] [[guided missile destroyer]], launched in 1962 and struck in 1992. The ship was sold to Greece to provide spare parts for other ships, and sunk as a target in 2003. * [[USNS Richard E. Byrd (T-AKE-4)|USNS ''Richard E. Byrd'' (T-AKE-4)]] is a [[Lewis and Clark class dry cargo ship|''Lewis and Clark''-class]] [[dry cargo ship]], launched in 2007 and active in service {{As of|2008|lc=on}}. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Richard E. Byrd}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
